mgSignalCharacteristics.name: mgSignalCharacteristics
mgSignalCharacteristics.contactinfo: DVB project European Broadcasting Union CH-1218 GRAND SACONNEX (Geneva) Switzerland Tel: +41 22 717 21 11 Fax: +41 22 717 24 81
mgSignalCharacteristics.description: DVB Measurement Group Signal Characteristics MIB module. This mgSignalCharacteristics module contains Transport Stream structure information and RF characteristics information to assist in interpreting measurements and tests, in particular those specified in TR 101 290.

CASystemID.name: CASystemID
CASystemID.description: Representation of CA_system_ID as found in a CA_descriptor. A value of -1 means that the CA_system_ID is unknown.

EncryptionState.name: EncryptionState
EncryptionState.description: Used to indicate whether a service or PID is encrypted or unencrypted. The value unknown means that the information is not available, for example because the instrument does not gather this information.

GuardInterval.name: GuardInterval
GuardInterval.description: Guard interval used in the DVB-T modulation scheme.

InnerCodeRate.name: InnerCodeRate
InnerCodeRate.description: This is used to specify the inner (Viterbi) code rate of a transmission.

NetworkID.name: NetworkID
NetworkID.description: This represents a network_id or original_network_id as used in the SI tables. A value of -1 indicates that value is unknown.

PID.name: PID
PID.description: An object of type PID directly represents an MPEG-2 PID number

ReadableString.name: ReadableString
ReadableString.description: An octet string containing a human-readable string. This string may have originally been encoded as specified in EN 300 468 Annex A, but this is not a requirement. To maintain generality, the information is represented using the ISO/IEC IS 10646-1 character set, encoded as an octet string using the UTF-8 transformation format described in RFC2279. Control codes are interpreted as specified in EN 300 468 Annex A, section A.1. The interpretation of other control codes is undefined. For information encoded in 7-bit US-ASCII, the UTF-8 encoding is identical to the US-ASCII encoding. UTF-8 may require multiple bytes to represent a single character/code point; thus the length of this object in octets may be different from the number of characters encoded. Similarly, size constraints refer to the number of encoded octets, not the number of characters represented by an encoding.

TerrestrialTransmissionMode.name: TerrestrialTransmissionMode
TerrestrialTransmissionMode.description: Used to inform whether a DVB-T transmission uses 2k or 8k mode.

tsStructureChangeTrap.name: tsStructureChangeTrap
tsStructureChangeTrap.description: Trap which is sent when any value within the mgTSStructure branch of this MIB changes. Transmission of the trap is subject to rate control through the structureTrapControlRateStatus object.

structureTrapControlTable.name: structureTrapControlTable
structureTrapControlTable.description: Per-input table of values which control the generation of tsStructureChangeTrap traps.

structureTrapControlInputNumber.name: structureTrapControlInputNumber
structureTrapControlInputNumber.description: Transport Stream input to which the trap control objects apply.

structureTrapControlOID.name: structureTrapControlOID
structureTrapControlOID.description: This object holds the OID of the object within the mgTSStructure branch of the MIB whose change triggered the trap. It is present for the formal purpose of defining the variable bindings returned with the tsStructureChangeTrap. It is not accessible for normal reading.

structureTrapControlChangeTime.name: structureTrapControlChangeTime
structureTrapControlChangeTime.description: This indicates the time when the change which triggered the trap occurred. It is present for the formal purpose of defining the variable bindings returned with the tsStructureChangeTrap. It is not accessible for normal reading.

structureTrapControlRateStatus.name: structureTrapControlRateStatus
structureTrapControlRateStatus.description: This object is used for rate control of traps, preventing overload of the management network by transmission of an excessive number of traps. The value 'disabled' means that traps are never sent. The value 'enabled' means that a trap will be sent when triggered. When a trap is sent, the agent changes the value of this object to 'enabledThrottled'. In this state the agent will not send any more traps. The agent automatically changes the value back to 'enabled' when the time specified by trapControlPeriod expires. A management application may set the value to 'enabled' at any time, but must never set the value to 'enabledThrottled'.

structureTrapControlPeriod.name: structureTrapControlPeriod
structureTrapControlPeriod.description: The agent will ensure that the interval between sending traps is no shorter than this time period (unless overridden by the manager).

structureTrapInput.name: structureTrapInput
structureTrapInput.description: The Transport Stream input whose change triggered the current trap. This information can also be obtained by analysing the structureTrapControlOID, but structureTrapInput provides the information directly. This object is present for the formal purpose of defining the variable bindings returned with the tsStructureChangeTrap. It is not accessible for normal reading.

mgTSTable.name: mgTSTable
mgTSTable.description: PSI/SI information relating to the whole Transport Stream

mgTSInputNumber.name: mgTSInputNumber
mgTSInputNumber.description: The physical input on which this Transport Stream appears

mgTSId.name: mgTSId
mgTSId.description: The transport_stream_id for this Transport Stream as read from the PAT. If the transport_stream_id is unknown, this object has the value -1.

mgTSOriginalNetworkID.name: mgTSOriginalNetworkID
mgTSOriginalNetworkID.description: The original_network_id for this Transport Stream. This is found by reading the transport_stream_id from the PAT. This transport_stream_id is then located in the transport_stream_loop of the NIT (actual transport stream). The value of mgTSOriginalNetworkID is the original_network_id found in this instance of the loop.

mgTSNetworkID.name: mgTSNetworkID
mgTSNetworkID.description: The network_id for this Transport Stream as read from the NIT. This is found by reading the network_id in the NIT (actual_network)

mgTSNetworkName.name: mgTSNetworkName
mgTSNetworkName.description: network_name for this Transport Stream as read from the NIT. This is found by reading the network name descriptor in the NIT (actual_network). If the network_name is unknown, the value of this object is a zero length string.

mgServiceTable.name: mgServiceTable
mgServiceTable.description: PSI/SI information relating to each service within the Transport Stream. A service is included in the table if it is found in both the PAT and the PMT.

mgServiceInputNumber.name: mgServiceInputNumber
mgServiceInputNumber.description: The physical input on which this Transport Stream appears

mgServiceNumber.name: mgServiceNumber
mgServiceNumber.description: The program_number/service_id to which the information in the rest of the row applies.

mgServiceType.name: mgServiceType
mgServiceType.description: The service_type from the service_descriptor field in the SDT. A value of -1 indicates that the service_type is unknown.

mgServiceName.name: mgServiceName
mgServiceName.description: The service_name from the service_descriptor in the SDT. If this information is not available, the value of this object will be a zero length string.

mgServiceProviderName.name: mgServiceProviderName
mgServiceProviderName.description: The service_provider_name from the service_descriptor in the SDT. If this information is not available, the value of this object will be a zero length string.

mgServicePMTPID.name: mgServicePMTPID
mgServicePMTPID.description: The PMT PID for this service as read from the PAT

mgServicePCRPID.name: mgServicePCRPID
mgServicePCRPID.description: The PCR PID for this service as read from the PMT

mgServiceCondAccess.name: mgServiceCondAccess
mgServiceCondAccess.description: The encryption state of the service, derived from the free_CA_mode bit in the SDT

mgServiceEITComponentDescriptor.name: mgServiceEITComponentDescriptor
mgServiceEITComponentDescriptor.description: This is a text description of the main elementary stream in the service as read from the component_descriptor in the EIT. If this information is not available, the value of this object will be a zero length string.

mgPIDTable.name: mgPIDTable
mgPIDTable.description: PSI/SI information relating to each PID in each service in the Transport Stream. A PID is included in the table if it listed as an elementary_PID in the PMT for the service.

mgPIDInputNumber.name: mgPIDInputNumber
mgPIDInputNumber.description: The physical input on which this Transport Stream appears

mgPIDServiceNumber.name: mgPIDServiceNumber
mgPIDServiceNumber.description: The program_number/service_id to which the row information applies.

mgPIDNumber.name: mgPIDNumber
mgPIDNumber.description: The PID, included in the service identified by mgPIDServiceNumber, to which the information in the row applies.

mgPIDType.name: mgPIDType
mgPIDType.description: The stream_type read from the PMT

mgPIDCondAccess.name: mgPIDCondAccess
mgPIDCondAccess.description: The encryption state of the PID. This is deduced from the values of the transport_scrambling_control field in the Transport Stream packet headers for this PID.

mgEMMTable.name: mgEMMTable
mgEMMTable.description: This table identifies the PIDs occupied by EMMs

mgEMMInputNumber.name: mgEMMInputNumber
mgEMMInputNumber.description: The physical input on which this Transport Stream appears

mgEMMCaPID.name: mgEMMCaPID
mgEMMCaPID.description: The CA_PID from the CA_descriptor in the CAT plus one. This indicates the PID on which the EMM is found.

mgEMMCASystemID.name: mgEMMCASystemID
mgEMMCASystemID.description: The CA_system_ID from the CA_descriptor in the CAT

mgServiceECMTable.name: mgServiceECMTable
mgServiceECMTable.description: This table identifies the PIDs occupied by ECMs relating to a whole service. This information is found in the first descriptor loop of a TS_program_map_section.

mgServiceECMInputNumber.name: mgServiceECMInputNumber
mgServiceECMInputNumber.description: The physical input on which this Transport Stream appears

mgServiceECMServiceNumber.name: mgServiceECMServiceNumber
mgServiceECMServiceNumber.description: The program_number/service_id to which the information in the row applies.

mgServiceECMCaPID.name: mgServiceECMCaPID
mgServiceECMCaPID.description: The CA_PID from the CA_descriptor in the PMT plus one. This indicates the PID on which the ECM is found.

mgServiceECMCASystemID.name: mgServiceECMCASystemID
mgServiceECMCASystemID.description: The CA_system_ID from the CA_descriptor in the PMT

mgPIDECMTable.name: mgPIDECMTable
mgPIDECMTable.description: This table identifies the PIDs occupied by ECMs related to a single elementary stream. This information is found in the elementary stream specific descriptor loop of a TS_program_map_section.

mgPIDECMInputNumber.name: mgPIDECMInputNumber
mgPIDECMInputNumber.description: The physical input on which this Transport Stream appears

mgPIDECMServiceNumber.name: mgPIDECMServiceNumber
mgPIDECMServiceNumber.description: The program_number/service_id to which the information in the row applies.

mgPIDECMPID.name: mgPIDECMPID
mgPIDECMPID.description: The elementary stream PID which is unscrambled by this ECM.

mgPIDECMCaPID.name: mgPIDECMCaPID
mgPIDECMCaPID.description: The CA_PID from the CA_descriptor in the PMT plus one. This indicates the PID on which the ECM is found.

mgPIDECMCASystemID.name: mgPIDECMCASystemID
mgPIDECMCASystemID.description: The CA_system_ID from the CA_descriptor in the PMT

mgNITDeliverySystemTable.name: mgNITDeliverySystemTable
mgNITDeliverySystemTable.description: Delivery system information for this Transport Stream read from the delivery system descriptors in the NIT. This information is found by reading the transport_stream_id from the PAT. This transport_stream_id is then located in the transport_stream_loop of the NIT (actual_network). The delivery system descriptor found in this instance of the loop is analysed to obtain the values in this table.

mgNITDSInputNumber.name: mgNITDSInputNumber
mgNITDSInputNumber.description: The physical input on which this Transport Stream appears

mgNITDSSystemType.name: mgNITDSSystemType
mgNITDSSystemType.description: Which delivery system is in use. The value of this object determines which other objects in this table row have valid values. If this object has the value 'unknown' none of the other objects in this table row have valid values.

mgNITDSFrequency.name: mgNITDSFrequency
mgNITDSFrequency.description: The frequency or centre_frequency for the transmission expressed in MHz Valid for: cable, satellite, terrestrial

mgNITDSFecOuter.name: mgNITDSFecOuter
mgNITDSFecOuter.description: The Outer Forward Error Correction Code, values as specified for the cable_delivery_system_descriptor. Valid for: cable

mgNITDSCableModulation.name: mgNITDSCableModulation
mgNITDSCableModulation.description: Modulation scheme, values as specified for the cable_delivery_system_descriptor Valid for: cable

mgNITDSSymbolRate.name: mgNITDSSymbolRate
mgNITDSSymbolRate.description: The symbol rate in symbols per second Valid for: cable, satellite

mgNITDSFecInner.name: mgNITDSFecInner
mgNITDSFecInner.description: The inner FEC scheme, values as specified for the cable_delivery_system_descriptor Valid for: cable, satellite

mgNITDSOrbitalPosition.name: mgNITDSOrbitalPosition
mgNITDSOrbitalPosition.description: The orbital position in degrees Valid for: satellite

mgNITDSWestEastFlag.name: mgNITDSWestEastFlag
mgNITDSWestEastFlag.description: Orbital position direction: east (1) or west (0). Valid for: satellite

mgNITDSPolarization.name: mgNITDSPolarization
mgNITDSPolarization.description: Polarization, values as specified for the satellite_delivery_system_descriptor Valid for: satellite

mgNITDSSatelliteModulation.name: mgNITDSSatelliteModulation
mgNITDSSatelliteModulation.description: Modulation scheme, values as specified for the satellite_delivery_system_descriptor Valid for: satellite

mgNITDSBandwidth.name: mgNITDSBandwidth
mgNITDSBandwidth.description: The bandwidth, values as specified for the terrestrial_delivery_system_descriptor Valid for: terrestrial

mgNITDSConstellation.name: mgNITDSConstellation
mgNITDSConstellation.description: The modulation constellation: values as specified for the terrestrial_delivery_system_descriptor Valid for: terrestrial

mgNITDSHierarchyInformation.name: mgNITDSHierarchyInformation
mgNITDSHierarchyInformation.description: Hierarchy Information: values as specified for the terrestrial_delivery_system_descriptor Valid for: terrestrial

mgNITDSCodeRateHPStream.name: mgNITDSCodeRateHPStream
mgNITDSCodeRateHPStream.description: The code rate for the high priority stream: values as specified for the terrestrial_delivery_system_descriptor Valid for: terrestrial

mgNITDSCodeRateLPStream.name: mgNITDSCodeRateLPStream
mgNITDSCodeRateLPStream.description: The code rate for low priority stream: values as specified for the terrestrial_delivery_system_descriptor Valid for: terrestrial

mgNITDSGuardInterval.name: mgNITDSGuardInterval
mgNITDSGuardInterval.description: The guard_interval: values as specified for the terrestrial_delivery_system_descriptor Valid for: terrestrial

mgNITDSTransmissionMode.name: mgNITDSTransmissionMode
mgNITDSTransmissionMode.description: The transmission_mode: values as specified for the terrestrial_delivery_system_descriptor Valid for: terrestrial

mgNITDSOtherFrequencyFlag.name: mgNITDSOtherFrequencyFlag
mgNITDSOtherFrequencyFlag.description: other_frequency_flag: values as specified for the terrestrial_delivery_system_descriptor Valid for: terrestrial

rfCharacteristicsChangeTrap.name: rfCharacteristicsChangeTrap
rfCharacteristicsChangeTrap.description: Trap which is sent when a value in the mgRFCharacteristics part of the MIB changes substantially. Transmission of the trap is subject to rate control through the rfCharacteristicsTrapControlRateStatus object.

rfCharacteristicsTrapControlTable.name: rfCharacteristicsTrapControlTable
rfCharacteristicsTrapControlTable.description: Per-input table of values which control the generation of rfCharacteristicsChangeTrap traps.

rfCharacteristicsTrapControlInputNumber.name: rfCharacteristicsTrapControlInputNumber
rfCharacteristicsTrapControlInputNumber.description: Transport Stream on which an RF value has changed, triggering the transmission of the trap.

rfCharacteristicsTrapControlOID.name: rfCharacteristicsTrapControlOID
rfCharacteristicsTrapControlOID.description: This object holds the OID of the object within the rfCharacteristics branch of the MIB whose change triggered the trap. It is present for the formal purpose of defining the variable bindings returned with the rfCharacteristicsChangeTrap. It is not accessible for normal reading. Note that this may not be the only value which has changed; managers need to poll to obtain all the new values that they need.

rfCharacteristicsTrapControlChangeTime.name: rfCharacteristicsTrapControlChangeTime
rfCharacteristicsTrapControlChangeTime.description: This indicates the time when the change which triggered the trap occurred. It is present for the formal purpose of defining the variable bindings returned with the rfCharacteristicsChangeTrap. It is not accessible for normal reading.

rfCharacteristicsTrapControlRateStatus.name: rfCharacteristicsTrapControlRateStatus
rfCharacteristicsTrapControlRateStatus.description: This object is used for rate control of traps, preventing overload of the management network by transmission of an excessive number of traps. The value 'disabled' means that traps are never sent. The value 'enabled' means that a trap will be sent when triggered. When a trap is sent, the agent changes the value of this object to 'enabledThrottled'. In this state the agent will not send any more traps. The agent automatically changes the value back to 'enabled' when the time specified by trapControlPeriod expires. A management application may set the value to 'enabled' at any time, but must never set the value to 'enabledThrottled'.

rfCharacteristicsTrapControlPeriod.name: rfCharacteristicsTrapControlPeriod
rfCharacteristicsTrapControlPeriod.description: The agent will ensure that the interval between sending traps is no shorter than this time period (unless overridden by the manager).

rfCharacteristicsTrapInput.name: rfCharacteristicsTrapInput
rfCharacteristicsTrapInput.description: The Transport Stream input whose change triggered the current trap. This information can also be obtained by analysing the rfCharacteristicsTrapOID, but rfCharacteristicsTrapInput provides the information directly. This object is present for the formal purpose of defining the variable bindings returned with the traps. It is not accessible for normal reading.

mgRFCharacteristicsTable.name: mgRFCharacteristicsTable
mgRFCharacteristicsTable.description: The RF characteristics of the input signal. These values represent the measuring instrument's 'best effort' to determine them.

mgRFInputNumber.name: mgRFInputNumber
mgRFInputNumber.description: The physical input on which these RF characteristics are found

mgRFSystemType.name: mgRFSystemType
mgRFSystemType.description: Which delivery system is in use: cable, satellite or terrestrial. The value of this object determines which other objects in this table have valid values.

mgRFCentreFrequency.name: mgRFCentreFrequency
mgRFCentreFrequency.description: This is the centre frequency to which the measuring equipment is tuned. This frequency is the actual input frequency to the measuring equipment, which may be at an intermediate frequency (IF) rather than the final RF. Valid for: cable, satellite, terrestrial

mgRFModulation.name: mgRFModulation
mgRFModulation.description: The modulation scheme in use Valid for: cable, satellite, terrestrial

mgRFFecInner.name: mgRFFecInner
mgRFFecInner.description: Inner Forward Error Correction scheme (also referred to as code rate). In the case of a hierarchical terrestrial transmission, this is the inner code rate for the high priority stream. Valid for: satellite, terrestrial

mgRFFecInnerLP.name: mgRFFecInnerLP
mgRFFecInnerLP.description: Inner Forward Error Correction scheme (also referred to as code rate). This is the code rate for the low priority stream in a hierarchical terrestrial transmission. Valid for: terrestrial

mgRFSymbolRate.name: mgRFSymbolRate
mgRFSymbolRate.description: Indicates the symbol rate of the transmission. Valid for: cable, satellite

mgRFBandwidth.name: mgRFBandwidth
mgRFBandwidth.description: Bandwidth of the signal. Normally this will be equivalent to the channel spacing. Valid for: terrestrial

mgRFTransmissionMode.name: mgRFTransmissionMode
mgRFTransmissionMode.description: Whether there are 2k or 8k carriers in the OFDM modulation scheme. Valid for: terrestrial

mgRFIsHierarchical.name: mgRFIsHierarchical
mgRFIsHierarchical.description: Whether the transmission is hierarchical Valid for: terrestrial

mgRFGuardInterval.name: mgRFGuardInterval
mgRFGuardInterval.description: The guard interval in use Valid for: terrestrial

mgSCTransportStreamCompliance.name: mgSCTransportStreamCompliance
mgSCTransportStreamCompliance.description: An implementation which provides all the information in the mgTSStructure part of the MIB and implements the tsStructureChangeTrap can claim this conformance.

mgSCRadioFrequencyCompliance.name: mgSCRadioFrequencyCompliance
mgSCRadioFrequencyCompliance.description: An implementation which provides all the information in the mgRFCharacteristics part of the MIB and implements the rfCharacteristicsChangeTrap can claim this conformance.

mgSCTransportStreamGroup.name: mgSCTransportStreamGroup
mgSCTransportStreamGroup.description: This group contains all the objects in the mgTSStructure part of the MIB.

mgSCRadioFrequencyGroup.name: mgSCRadioFrequencyGroup
mgSCRadioFrequencyGroup.description: This group contains all the objects in the mgRFCharacteristics part of the MIB
